The radius of curvature is the radius of a circle that the vehicle is following as it turns. The smaller the radius of curvature, the tighter the turn, and the larger the radius of curvature, the wider the turn.

Radius of curvature = (Track width / 2) / tan (Wheel angle / 2)

* Wheel angle is the angle of the wheels in degrees.
* tan is the trigonometric function that returns the tangent of an angle.
